item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, December 19, 2024 at 11:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Developing Developers (2015) (61 points | 12 comments)
2. Solaar is a Linux manager for many Logitech keyboards, mice, and other devices (442 points | 185 comments)
3. Blackmagic Debuts $30K 3D Camera for Capturing Video for Vision Pro (28 points | 11 comments)
4. Markov Keyboard: keyboard layout that changes by Markov frequency (101 points | 54 comments)
5. Show HN: Postgres as a VectorDB GUI (96 points | 12 comments)
6. Firenvim – Turn the browser into a Neovim client (89 points | 17 comments)
7. Piccolo OS, a Small Multitasking OS for the Raspberry Pi Pico (104 points | 13 comments)
8. Borrow Checking, RC, GC, and Eleven Other Memory Safety Approaches (50 points | 16 comments)
9. ISO 8583: The language of credit cards (295 points | 52 comments)
10. Self-sorting arrays reveal unexpected competencies in minimal intelligence (121 points | 37 comments)
11. Exposing the Clearingstelle Urheberrecht Im Internet (CUII) (91 points | 19 comments)
12. Our brains create mental "chapters" with new event segmentation study (88 points | 4 comments)
13. Genesis – a generative physics engine for general-purpose robotics (65 points | 20 comments)
14. Error Stacking in Rust (80 points | 28 comments)
15. Apple Watch with Android (173 points | 106 comments)
16. Updates to H-1B (352 points | 964 comments)
17. The RAM Myth (102 points | 70 comments)
18. Launch HN: Innate (YC F24) – Home robots as easy to program as AI agents (139 points | 63 comments)
19. Alignment faking in large language models (104 points | 83 comments)
20. Amazon workers to strike at multiple US warehouses during busy holiday season (110 points | 54 comments)
21. Moon (2915 points | 239 comments)
22. There's No Such Thing as Software Productivity (2012) (95 points | 87 comments)
23. Analyzing the World Chess Championship 2024: Empirical synthesized approach (26 points | 29 comments)
24. Half My Life with Perl (94 points | 53 comments)
25. Argentine rodents are Dubai oasis' newest residents (10 points | 2 comments)
26. Embedding Lua in Sqleibniz with Rust (46 points | 1 comment)
27. Khalid Sheldrake: The East Dulwich man who would be King (35 points | 22 comments)
28. Torpedo juice: Legendary, illegal WWII liquor drunk in Alaska and the world (47 points | 26 comments)
29. Scientists learning to 'write' skills to human brain noninvasively, like Matrix (11 points | 5 comments)
30. Windshield pitting incidents in Washington reach fever pitch on April 15, 1954 (2003) (291 points | 240 comments)
